page.title: 05ASHFIELD SCHOOL, BUSHEY
page.content: A British School Foundation, the school was opened in January 1846. It is the oldest school in the Bushey area. It is unique in Hertfordshire, having voluntary controlled status but no religious affiliation. The building of the original school is still used as 2 classrooms. The school house is occupied by the Headmaster. Until 1969 Ashfield was an all boys school. In the 19th Century boys came to the school from all over Bushey, Oxhey and Stanmore. The school has been extended ,there are now 8 class areas, dining room, kitchen, hall, library, office and staffroom besides the original building. There is a large playingfield, tree lined with a natural pond.Ashfield is named after Arthur Ashfield, Lord Abercorn's head gardener,a benefactor of the school. His grave is in St.James Churchyard.
